data.title: Late night dinner
data.text: This local place has a great atmosphere and great food. The steak was cooked perfectly and the sauce used can not be beat. I recommend the steak with fries every time.

data.title: BIRTHDAY "Blues"
data.text:
Loved this restaurant til last night!...had reviewed it previously and had given it RAVE REVIEWS!
Celebrating with two other couples..EVERYTHING WAS OFF! Four of us had drinks at the bar, til our other friends arrived..then we sat at our table. Our waiter came over and introduced himself, WISHED me Happy Birthday+told us he'd be "taking care of us" and boy did he, and "NOT" in a good way!..Ordered some more drinks...and that was the last we saw of OUR waiter for about 15 minutes..I literally had to wave my hands and shout hello to get his attention..(also tried to get the attention of several other waiters,to no avail). I even said to our waiter this isn't going well,did you forget us..waiter apologized..but things got worse. Ordered.. apps & salads, food came out very slowly, food was good, til that point..then another long lag..maybe 30 minutes..one couple who dines there regularly, their steaks weren't good, my girlfriend wanted to send hers back, but hubby said mines not right either..but just didn't want the hassle of sending food back,probably because it would have taken so long to get our waiter's attention. Had ordered a baked potato with my lobster..no potato..and then another couple sat with NO FOOD..Finally someone came over and said the chef didn't like the way their steak looked and was preparing another one..it would just be a few minutes..by the time we were almost thru dining..their food came out..and we asked for our potato..One couple ordered a souffle and our waiter brought out a cake with candles my friend had brought..they took the cake back, and that was the last we saw of it, I'm not kidding for 15 minutes..then someone came over and said the chef wanted to add berries and whipped cream..finally the cut cake came out..
It was great being with my friends on my birthday, but we all said something was "off" at Viande Rouge, last nite..It was one of the couple's first time dining there, the one's whose steak didn't come out til late..upon leaving we went to our car and some young kids were there smoking+drinking beer in the parking lot..using our Lexus as a bar table..It may be awhile if I ever want to go back. Oh yeah~ I got the birthday card on the table signed by everyone..but not exactly the same service SouthernGirlTraveler received..previous review.

data.title: Such a cozy and romantic restaurant
data.text: I just love this restaurant.  It have amazing ambiance.  The food is wonderful  The drinks are fantastic.. mixologist treat.  Overall a little pricey, but oh so decadent.  love the cozy atmosphere.  Arrived early in the evening and some of the locals were at the bar and just enjoying a couple of drinks.  Chef came to the table to present the meal and was very gracious.  Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable  Just love this place.

data.title: So fantastic, I made a second reservation for the same week!
data.text:
Three evenings ago (Monday), I took a friend to celebrate her birthday. I mentioned the occasion when I made the reservation. Imagine our delight when we were shown to our table, and there awaited a birthday card for my friend, signed by every staff member. Wow! Every person that approached our table said, "Happy Birthday", and truly helped make it a very special dinner for both of us. 
Four servers, plus the bartender took care of our table and gave us amazing service for the entire evening.
Our food was wonderful! We ordered Raw Blue Point Oysters, Crab Beignets, Caesar Salad, Beef Bourguignon, Crème Brûlée, wine, coffee.
I was so impressed with every aspect of the restaurant that I came home and made a reservation for this coming Friday night, to celebrate our son's 18th birthday.

data.title: Courteous staff - Fine Dining for Sophisticated Gourmands
data.text: Very courteous staff, who knows the dishes well, and can make good recommendations. Delicious Fine Dining for sophisticated gourmands. Debbie and I enjoyed and celebrated every bite. They will customize dish or party arrangements. You may want to consult your hard copy map to find it; the GPS might lead you astray.

data.title: Great Anniversary Meal!
data.text: My husband and I didn't intend to go to dinner to celebrate this year, but after our "alternate plans" ended we were starving. We live 40 minutes outside of Atlanta and didn't feel like driving all the way to Buckhead so we looked closer to home. Boy were we glad we did! On the night we went they had a lamb shank special. Luckily, my husband ordered the LAST one they had because he loved every bite. The atmosphere was perfect for a romantic dinner and the service was superb. Not only do we have another year of marriage under our belts, but we also have a local place to enjoy a fine dining experience. Thank you!

data.title: Sixteen Year Old Birthday Celebration
data.text: This is a very nice Restaurant. It is small and quaint; dark rich red velvety walls. Minimum age requirement:14.  I see what they mean by adult environment. Reminds you of a club during the roaring twenties.  Staff is very cordial.  Our waiter Crawford, was vey knowledgeable. We had a party of six. Everyone ate a steak; NY Strip, Rib Eye, Pepper Steak and Veal. It was all delicious. Sides are a la cart, to feed two or three people.  Appetizer: Lobster spread and crab balls were delicious!!  We ended dinner with dessert which  was ok. Chocolate cream pie, had more cream less chocolate. We also had banana foster. Could had used more caramelization, but the flavor was good. Overall it was a good experience.

data.title: Fabulous Place!
data.text: We dined here the evening of July 14, Bastille Day in France and the day the terrorists hit Nice, France.  We wanted to celebrate France.  We had a very positive experience here.  Our waiter was top-notch.  The menu is exhaustive - there are just so many things to chose from.  We started off with escargot.  It is not the typical escargot you get with the little tongs and in the shells.  But very delicious, nonetheless.  There are no shells and tongs, but a very delicious sauce with the garlic, butter and the additions of mushrooms and tomatoes.  The entree was a tough decision, but our waiter said that the steak au poivre was the best.  We both tried it and it absolutely was wonderful.  We shared a sauteed spinach, since everything is a la carte here.  The wine menu is impressive and we each had a glass  - pinot noir for me and cabernet for him.  We will be back to dine, but probably only occasionally, as it is a little on the expensive side.  But well worth the cost.

data.title: Catch up with Friends
data.text: Viande Rouge has a great setting that works to catch up with old friends, business dinner, or that special occasion. You have to try various courses from starters to soup/ salad, mains, and of course you gab to try their soufflés. The steaks are good but I would suggest going with some of those French specials or seafood. Wether you get their classic French onion soup or one of the salads made table side it is going to be a great time.

data.title: Why The French Name?
data.text: Viande Rouge is about as French as I am. Upon arriving I attempted to order a French aperitif which no one in the house had ever heard of nor ever served. The side order of potatoes Dauphinois was served as plain home fried potatoes sautéed with onion which is in no way representative of the named dish. The three meat portions at the table were adequate in quality and presentation. The wine selection was in no way outstanding. The only thing that evening that was truly outstanding were the prices. There are better choices for steak in the area all of which do not feign an international cuisine so worthy of respect.

data.title: Special Anniversary Dinner
data.text: Our waiter was simply terrific.  While this is really a steak house, the special for the evening was South African lobster tails stuffed with crab and lobster.  It was over the top delicious.  We closed out the evening with Bananas Foster -  simply delicious

data.title: An excellent dining experience
data.text: This is a great place for special occasion dinners.  The upscale steak house serves excellent food.  Very good experience with friendly wait staff.

data.title: A new favorite
data.text: We celebrated our wedding anniversary last night at Viande Rouge and it was one of the best meals we've ever had in metro Atlanta.  The service was outstanding and we were even given a congratulatory card signed by the entire staff.  I ordered an Old Fashioned from the bar and it was perfectly prepared.  The Steak Diane, prepared at the table, was equally perfect as was my wife's filet.  The restaurant is also quiet enough that you can have a conversation without shouting across the table.  I can't say enough good things about our experience there last night.  We will definitely be back!

data.title: Consistently excellent
data.text: Had dinner at VR last Saturday. Food is consistently top notch. Have a Caesar salad and the burger. Wine bar remains deep and fairly pricedA great local John's Creek institution.

data.title: Special Occasions
data.text: One of the few restaurants that has an age limit so you can enjoy a nice evening without worrying about children, including your own.

data.title: Best in Atlanta
data.text: We simply love it.  Great appetizers, fried lobster tail is my favorite.  The service is friendly, and spot on.  They have great knowledge of the menu, and can make a special night even better. Jim and Belynda

data.title: Where Class meets Elagance!
data.text:
This restaurant was  voted 'most romantic restaurant in GA' for 2016 OPEN TABLE, and I see why! West & Daniel were phenomenal server!! West, is the one who was telling me some of the fun factoids about the place. We had a wonderful experience from the beginning to the end of the night. Everything & everyone was so polished and more importantly, pleasant. I observed Richard & Ryan-- who i dubbed 'the super servers' because they were hard at work every time I saw them!
Erin, the manager on duty, was a magnificent manager! Her and I talked & agreed that although this place is extremely romantic, it is also family/kid friendly because everyone is so warm and friendly.The staff knows the regulars by name! Paul was also one of the hard working server that assisted us towards the end of the night. I love the private room the party was in. The main color of the restaurant is red and it is timeless! What a wonderful evening! See you guys again soon. This is one of my new favorite places! ~Ashli H. ❤ ❤ ❤ ❤ ❤

data.title: Quite Atmosphere for Special Occasions
data.text: My wife and I recently tried this restaurant for the first time to celebrate our anniversary. The atmosphere was wonderful, cozy, very "rouge", and formal enough to make the occasion feel special. The crab cake was delightful for an appetizer, though small and difficult to share. The fillets were filled with taste, and prepared with a grilled flavor that was enjoyably unique. There are perhaps one or two other places in the Duluth, Roswell, johns Creek area that I feel have better cuts and offerings of beef, however VR's was nothing to scoff at for sure. The souffle was a little under done, but we did move through our dinner rather quickly. The waiter was very informed and attentive. It was slightly unusual to be told that our wine selection would require them to walk down to the liquor store?? - perhaps convenient for them, but did I need to know that? Overall a great anniversary experience, and one we would return to for a nice private dinner.

data.title: Best steak ever
data.text: bone in filet is fantastic.  Nice service, quiet atmosphere.  This is a good place for a great steak and also very good for a business dinner.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: We had an 830pm reservation and arrived at 815pm.  Our table was ready and we were quickly seated.  Our waiter had a very dry sense of humor, he could have brought more pizazz to our dining experience.  Cocktails were great.  Appetizers - cheese fondue and baked oysters were perfect!  Lollipop lamb chops, Beef Bourguignon & Steak Diane - cooked right at the table, now this employee was entertaining and made the tableside service worth it!  We all enjoyed our entrees.  Asparagus was less then desirable.  For dessert the chocolate cake is so light and was perfect.  Banana Fosters was cooked right at the table again and we ensured the same employee came back to entertain us.  There is a small private dining room in the rear. Ladies - be careful with the floor, we found it to be slippery when walking.  The ambiance of the venue was rouge just like the namesake.  Tables were not on top of one another to hear other peoples conversations.  A hidden gem in a shopping strip that is definitely worth it.
